and Greg Walden , of Oregon, have reintroduced proposed legislation that would prohibit the Federal Communications Commission from requiring that broadcasters give free airtime to opposing sides on controversial issues, according to Fox News. The American people cherish freedom, especially freedom of speech and of the press, said Mike Pence . ''Bringing back the Fairness Doctrine would amount to government control over political views expressed on the public airways. We must pass the Broadcaster Freedom Act and bury the Fairness Doctrine once and for all.

Print US ex-defence head Donald Rumsfeld defends Iraq war handling Former US Defence Donald Rumsfeld remains largely defiant about the Iraq war, saying in a new book that had Saddam Hussein remained in power, the Middle East would be far more perilous than it is today. Mr Donald Rumsfeld , 78, has written an autobiography due out next week. He concedes he could have sent more troops, and that internal US rivalries hampered post-war reconstruction. On the question

been burned for three straight games of at least 40 points by the 76ers All-Star. ''Honestly, they play me one-on-one, straight up,'' Allen Iverson said of a Bucks' defense he penetrated at will.
